pullRequest.title: fix: do not skip setting default world generator
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #4024. 🤞
oh, and some fixes for raw type warnings that probably don't have anything to do with this error, I was just preemptively fixing warnings I ran in to while debugging in case they would lead me to something.
How to test
Test gameplay modes other than Josharias Survival. (JS should still work too, of course.)
Make sure you can play the game without going to the advanced setup screen.
Make sure the world type is the one chosen by the module.txt for that mode.
Try without interacting with the Gameplay Template menu at all; get the gameplay mode you're testing to be the default one by removing other types.
Try with a fresh config.cfg (move your old one out of the way).

commit.message: fix: do not skip setting default world generator for default gameplay module
fix: remove use of raw types

nodes.bodyText:
Why did this become necessary?
It looks like the default generator was only used under a specific condition. Now you are potentially overwriting the generator, regardless the value of configDefaultModuleName.
The changes to DefaultWorldGeneratorPluginLibrary.java are fixing the issue on their own btw.
I was able to reproduce the necessity of this change.
